website_summaries.verdict: Grado's audiophile-friendly SR225i headphones deliver stellar sound quality, though some design caveats may limit their appeal for on-the-go listening.
cons: large 6.3mm plug requires adapter (not included) to interface with portable audio sources
open-backed design lets in external sound

customer_reviews.title: The threshold for reliability.
customer_reviews.text: This is the Grado threshold for headphones (also love the styli). Each pair of Grados, as I upgraded, I loved. But they had various weak connections, which meant a lot of fudging, to get a clear signal from each channel. These don't do that. I've got a 25' 1/4" to 1/8" adapter connected to them, and I never lose a channel. I'm not easy on my headphones. I fall asleep on them in not-sober states. These have held up, and are still working in 2018 (though the ear pads have degraded, they are a $20 replacement item).
customer_reviews.author: A shopper

customer_reviews.title: They May Be The Sweet Spot In The Prestige Series
customer_reviews.text: I am a definite fanboy of the 225i. I have had the 60 and 80i,both great models,but the 225i has brought me the most pleasure thus far. More bass is the noticeable difference in comparison to my previous models. I like the thicker,and shorter,cable considering where I sit and use the 225i. My set-up is right next to me so a short cable works best for me. The only that I don't like are the L cushions. I can't stand them because of the way they sit on my ears. I find it annoying. I switched to the G cushions which cover my ears and I find that more comfortable while not affecting the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne White

customer_reviews.title: Grado SR 225i Prestige Series Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to repeat all of the accolades others have given to these SR 225i headphones as they are all well deserved. I will mention two tips that have paid big dividends. First, do yourself a favor and invest in the Grado G cushions. The sound opens up and is considerably more balanced top to bottom. It's a very noticeable difference from the get-go. Second, before you listen with either set of cushions, take them off and wash them well in water with a few drops of dish soap. It softens them up a little. -dm / FL
customer_reviews.author: -dm

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Just wow.
customer_reviews.text: The clarity, crispness, sound quality, etc of these headphones is phenomenal. Also very comfortable to wear for hours on end while working (computer stuff). Pros: Great sound Great power handling Lightweight Comfortable Cons: Thick cord Cord is a little short, could be a foot or two longer 1/4" jack means you'll need a 1/4 to 1/8 adapter for most uses. (adapter strangely not included)
customer_reviews.author: Gordon S. Marlowe

customer_reviews.title: a worthy upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Sennheiser PC166's for about 2 years. It thought they sounded ok. I figured that since I use either the USB adapter that came with them or onboard audio, the audio quality from my computer would be the most limiting factor in terms of fidelity. I could not have been more wrong. The 166's sound muffled and horrible compared to the SR225i's when playing internet radio music. This review is not about comparing two headphones that are naturally worlds apart, but to let people that upgrading headphones is well worth it, even if you're not using an expensive receiver or sound card.
customer_reviews.author: languageguy

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sound great even at higher volumes(caution you can damage your hearing from setting volume too high) Well constructed Thick wires Cons: The ear pads it comes with aren't very comfortable cords a bit short but you could always get an extension comes with 1/4" plug and no 1/8" adapter What I did to get around the comfort issue, was to take the pads from another set of headphones and use them over the original, which makes the head phones perfectly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker J Pelletier

customer_reviews.title: Sound is very good. Foam cushion that cushions the ear become a ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound is very good. Foam cushion that cushions the ear become a messy crumbling dry powder after two years. Would not buy again, and no longer use.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Arger

customer_reviews.title: I kind of liked my SR80i's more
customer_reviews.text: I kind of liked my SR80i's more. Sounds great for sure though. Not as mobile but great for home listening.
customer_reviews.author: chris butler

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty expensive but if you really want a product worth it...look no more! They are great for those who can afford it. I was skeptical about spending so much for a pair but these blew me away. They sound amazing without anything else needed. (just your ears). you can buy an amp for $30 bucks and make em sound relatively better. dont use these for anywhere loud....these arent designed for noise reduction...not the most comfortable either. they are incredibly solid for sound though. 4.5/5
customer_reviews.author: Sam14

customer_reviews.title: while the 225 I headphones sounded great, they didn't hold up well at all
customer_reviews.text: while the 225 I headphones sounded great, they didn't hold up well at all. They only lasted a couple of months before one side dropped out. I returned them to the mfg. They repaired them and they lasted about a week. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: B. W. Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are perfect for me. Big soundstage, crisp highs, tight bass. I listen to a lot of acoustic music live and these phones really reproduce the true sound. I returned Sennheiser 595s which sounded distant and muddled, I am so glad I tried these.
customer_reviews.author: WAL

customer_reviews.title: Stunning headphones.
customer_reviews.text: The sound from these is so incredible. My only issue with them is comfort. They can be a bit fatiguing on the ears. I recommend getting the larger pads for it (VERY simple to replace). There is also no sound isolation.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Moen

customer_reviews.title: yeah... I heard new stuff in the music, too
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They sound detailed and layered enough without an amp to almost be as good at my AKGs with a great amp. I was very impressed. Music is once again rediscoverable with these.
customer_reviews.author: coolbeans

customer_reviews.title: Made me re-listen all my favs
customer_reviews.text: These sound absolutely incredible. You really start being able to hear every sound in music without it blending into a mush. I'm re-listening to all my favorite music. So far I've tried rock, dubstep, and folk, which all sound really really great. My favorite is rock so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Mikkola

customer_reviews.title: Step Up to Hear The Difference
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. Though a little tight on the ears out of the box, they loosened up nicely. They sound great, and are built to last. I finally found a great product made in the U.S.A. I didn't think there were any left.
customer_reviews.author: DtheM

customer_reviews.title: If I could give more stars I would
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, I've wanted a pair of Grado's for a long time and finally had the ability to purchase some. I could not be happier with my choice. I am re-discovering my entire music collection. So many of the tracks I thought I knew intimately have become brand new to me again!
customer_reviews.author: leslie Wangenheim

customer_reviews.title: Looks uncomfortable but sounds amazing
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine but I have a feeling these headphones will not last a long time. I wish the cable weren't so thick and the headphones came with 1/4in to 3.5mm adapter. After some listening continuously night and day, I find a tolerable comfort can be achieved by bending the headband to relax the pressure over your ears. Style and comfort considerations isn't very obvious here. When something with this amazing sound quality, you naturally want it to at least look durable and last some time. If my Toshiba U845W laptop is the only computer out there with amazing sound quality, these headphones should be the only required accessory.
customer_reviews.author: H. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY impressed by these headphones, especially for the $200 price tag. They are very detailed, even at very low volume levels, and the bass is not overkill. I have listened to mostly blues and classical so far on these, and I actually think I like how these sound better than I like how my (far far more expensive) speakers sound! I've got about 10 hours on them so far, not sure how long they take to break in but I love them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: great sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: crisp clean realistic full sound. A wonderful product.Audiophile quality. These are not sound isolating, or bass boosting or any other gimmick - just great sound reproduction.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Adams

customer_reviews.title: Hard Driving and Fast, but ....
customer_reviews.text: Old school design, no padding on head band, lots of cheapo looking plastic. At the same price of the Beyerdynaqmic DT-1350, it does not present itself in the same category, it looks like it was designed n the 70's. That being said, it is very good for fast modern rock. If it only had a little more base and punch, I would have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Dodgercat

customer_reviews.title: Grados!
customer_reviews.text: Great grados. I definetely enjoy these, I don't use my speakers anymore, just listen to my movies and music with this. I can hear people walking in the background, I can hear subtle sounds in movies, instruments I've never heard in songs. GREAT! When you first get it it will be uncomfortable, but then once you break it in it's wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Selim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: SR225i is my first headphones, In fact if you are a beginner of headphones,like me, please choose SR225i. Only spend $200,and you will get best sound experience!
customer_reviews.author: yuzhou sun

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Clarity!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have to be "broke in" but after a couple days of heavy use they are just fabulous! It would be smart to get them out of their box, plug them in and play them overnight a couple nights before you scrutinize their sound. I am very happy with these headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Joel E. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Terribly uncomfortable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I found the Grado SR 225i's far too uncomfortable to wear. I'm sure for normal ears they feel ok, but one of my ears was burned badly and the sratchy interior of the Grado ear cup rubs against the deformed cartiledge. If only the foam part covered the entire interior and not just the circumference. The sound however was top notch! I just wish I could enjoy the quality for any amount of time. I returned them and got the Sennheiser HD 25-1's instead. I've tried those before and they felt nice on my ears. Also, for such expensive headphones, you'd think they'd take more care and finesse with the packaging. It was exceptionally flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyungsun Orr

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: These headphones lack nuance. Unmusical and cold. Hard on the ears.
customer_reviews.author: Michael long

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cans
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, great sound, listen to tunes on this all day, as my co-worker likes to yap and has an annoying limey stutter
customer_reviews.author: the Barman

customer_reviews.title: Grado rs225
customer_reviews.text: I'v always relyed on the Grado name for there tonearm and cartriges in the past. When it came time for headphones it was only natural to go to the Grado line first ! love them !
customer_reviews.author: elp

customer_reviews.title: great sound, however, quite uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: the quality of the sound is every bit as advertised. after all the research and all i put into this, i was pretty satisfied with how it lived up to my expectations. the only down side is that it is pretty bulky. ears start to hurt after a while. other than that i highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lama

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed makes this a loser
customer_reviews.text: The metal posts that attach to the earpieces is poorly designed and broke on the left and right plastic earpiece sides! I used epoxy glue for a temporary fix but ended up buying another brand (Sennheiser Momentum On-Ear) to replace these. Very disappointed to say the least!
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Nagasawa

customer_reviews.title: Grado SR225i Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Very pronounced audio, but a little high pitched for my liking. I'm hoping that resolves itself after some breakin period.
customer_reviews.author: KC in Vero Beach

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...when they work
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones....when they function. I bought these to use as monitors at the church. After about a month one side died...then the other about a month after that. I got them repaired under warranty. A couple of months after the warranty was up, one side died again. Now both sides are out a second time and no warranty. For such expensive headphone I expected better quality. Very, very disappointed. I would not purchase from Grado again or point anyone else toward them. Perhaps I just got a bad set, but they've been really bad.
customer_reviews.author: thekeefus

product_meta.title: Grado Prestige Series SR225i Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Newly upgraded Grado SR225i headphones feature an innovative diaphragm and UHPLC (Ultra-high purity, long crystal) copper wire voice coil specially designed for increased bass response and a larger perceived sound stage. The diaphragms are put through a special 'de-stressing' process in order to enhance inner detail. An improved headband spring provides ample comfort, allowing the listener to relax and enjoy the fine tonal spread and balance. Bass, midrange and treble are incredibly open. What does the letter 'i' stand for in the new SR225i from Grado? Improved, that's what! The main features are the same as the SR125i, with its new driver, cable, and housing designs, but this headphone also has an increased rear air flow, utilizes Grado’s larger ear cushion and has closer matched drivers. Airflow is increased by 50%, which is achieved through an improved rear metal screen. The use of closer matched drivers and the larger cushions results in an enlarged soundstage, while the improved rear screen frees the headphone from colorations. "The SR225s sound unlike any other headphone. They have an amazingly solid presentation, packed with weight and presence. There is also a pleasant richness in the midrange that benefits all types of music," reports England's What Hi-Fi? magazine. "When it comes to classical music, the Grados reproduce instruments with both believable timbre and solidity. The treble boosts fine detail and no hint of aggression… These Grados are hard to beat!" Although the SR225 is similar to the bestselling SR125, its design increases air flow by 50 percent via an improved rear metal screen and closer matched drivers. The result is an enlarged soundstage achieved from closer driver tolerances, while the improved rear screen frees the headphone from coloration. "Music flows through this headphone organically and believably, with irrepressible dynamics and bounce," reports issue 163 of Hi-fi Choice magazine. "It gives good expression to the d

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars124 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
